captions.text: - Well hello everyone!

My name is Tyler Oakley and
today I wanted to give you

a little piece of advice
that I was once given
that helped me through a time in my life
when I just felt like a loser.

And, whatever way you
might feel like a loser,
if you ever do feel like a loser,
people don't get it.
It's like when I feel like this,

it's because I feel like
I'm not accomplishing
what I want to accomplish.
Or, other people are doing better than me,
or I'm just like not necessarily
where I want to be in life,
or whatever it is, I just feel like

people wont get it, I'm
going through my own thing,
I just feel like shit.
That's it.
And a lot of that has to do
with comparing yourself to others,

which I know is just part
of being competitive,

I'm pretty competitive,
but whether or not you're
competitive, you will eventually
compare yourself to others

because they'll get a
part you want in a play,
or they'll get the spot that you want,
or the solo you want, or a job you want,
or a college admission that you want,

and if you spend your
life comparing yourself

to everyone around you,
you will never be happy.
There's always going to be somebody
whose killing it in some way that you will
maybe not ever be able to.

But, the good thing is you
are going to be killing it
in your own ways.
If you feel like a loser,
I guess the most important thing is

if there were a contest
to being who you are,
there will never be anybody in the world
who will beat you.
That's one way you will always win.

You will always be the
number one version of you.
You will always win that!

So, if you every feel
like you're down and out,
and you suck in every way,
I guess, have happiness in the fact

that nobody will every
be a better you than you!

Even Meryl Streep, one of the
best actresses of all time,
will never be able to pull off
being you, as well as you can be you.

And I think there's something
to be said for that.
So, yeah.
I hope that helps.
I hope you feel less shitty
about the situation that you're in,
if you're in a shitty situation.

If you like this video, be
sure to give it a thumbs up!
If you want to see my latest video,
click right there!

If you want to hear my latest
podcast, click right there!

If you want to be my person of
the week, click right there!
And I will see you guys next time.
OK, later!

title: If You Feel Like A Loser... | Tyler Oakley

comments.text:
Thank you. This really helped me a lot. It's, well, It's my birthday today. 
I was having the time of my life. I got to spend the entire half of the day 
with my bestfriend and my family, to eat at an all-you-can-eat buffet for 
hours, to get some new pair of shoes, to get a new cute stuffed toy, and 
even see an awesome band. Everything was fine until my friend pranked me. 
The prank really made me feel sad but It was a prank so I didn't heed to 
it. I wanted to get her back so I pranked her that I was gonna prank her in 
school. She started swearing at me and started hating me. She told me she 
had anxiety and I could've killed her. I told her sorry but then she 
started saying mean stuff at me. I told her that I'm sorry again and that I 
couldn't do anything (which I am also sorry about) because we were chatting 
through the internet and that I don't know how to help her. She didn't 
stop. She kept swearing and swearing at me and she kept saying mean things 
about me.
Thank you for making me feel better :)﻿

comments.text:
I know this video is old, but right now I'm feeling just like that and 
watching this has brighten my day. Sometimes you work hard to achieve 
things and they won't happen, so as a result of that I got frustrated and I 
start to make excuses to not do anything during the whole day but 
complaining and whining about how bad things turn out for me instead of 
trying again or simply start doing other things. Of course I been lately 
working on my attitude and trying to be more positive about things, trying 
new hobbies, start looking for opportunities and possibilities. I know I'm 
a bit old to feel like a looser because I'm 23 but whatever I'll get over 
it sooner or later. ﻿
